item.title: Predicting Cryptocurrency Prices Using Regression Models | KDnuggets
item.description: In this article, we explore how to get started with the prediction of cryptocurrency prices using multiple linear regression. The factors investigated include predictions on various time intervals as ...
item.content:encoded: In this article, we explore how to get started with the prediction of cryptocurrency prices using multiple linear regression. The factors investigated include predictions on various time intervals as well as the use of various features in the models such as opening price, high price, low price and volume.

item.description: My day can vary, it really depends on which phase of the project I'm on. Let‚Äôs say we want to add a feature to our product ‚Äì my tasks could range from designing solutions and working with the team to ...
item.content:encoded: My day can vary, it really depends on which phase of the project I'm on. Let‚Äôs say we want to add a feature to our product ‚Äì my tasks could range from designing solutions and working with the team to find the best one, to deploying new features into production and doing maintenance. Along the way, I‚Äôll communicate changes to our stakeholders, write docs, code and test solutions, build analytics dashboards, clean-up old code, and fix bugs.

item.description: Posted by Pasin Manurangsi and Chiyuan Zhang, Research Scientists, Google Research Over the last several years, there has been an increased focus on developing differential privacy (DP) machine learni...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Pasin Manurangsi and Chiyuan Zhang, Research Scientists, Google Research Over the last several years, there has been an increased focus on developing differential privacy (DP) machine learning (ML) algorithms. DP has been the basis of several practical deployments in industry ‚Äî and has even been employed by the U.S. Census ‚Äî because it enables the understanding of system and algorithm privacy guarantees. The underlying assumption of DP is that changing a single user‚Äôs contribution to a...

item.title: Building a culture of pioneering responsibly | DeepMind Blog
item.description: When I joined DeepMind as COO, I did so in large part because I could tell that the founders and team had the same focus on positive social impact. In fact, at DeepMind, we now champion a term that pe...
item.content:encoded: When I joined DeepMind as COO, I did so in large part because I could tell that the founders and team had the same focus on positive social impact. In fact, at DeepMind, we now champion a term that perfectly captures my own values and hopes for integrating technology into people‚Äôs daily lives: pioneering responsibly. I believe pioneering responsibly should be a priority for anyone working in tech. But I also recognise that it‚Äôs especially important when it comes to powerful, widespread technolog...

item.description: In October 2021, we announced that we acquired the MuJoCo physics simulator, and made it freely available for everyone to support research everywhere. We also committed to developing and maintaining M...
item.content:encoded: In October 2021, we announced that we acquired the MuJoCo physics simulator, and made it freely available for everyone to support research everywhere. We also committed to developing and maintaining MuJoCo as a free, open-source, community-driven project with best-in-class capabilities. Today, we‚Äôre thrilled to report that open sourcing is complete and the entire codebase is on GitHub! Here, we explain why MuJoCo is a great platform for open-source collaboration and share a preview of our roadma...

I never thought DeepMind would accept me, and when they did, I thought it was a mistake. Everyone doubts themselves ‚Äì I‚Äôve never felt like the smartest person in the room. item.description: Posted by Jiahui Yu, Senior Research Scientist, and Jing Yu Koh, Research Software Engineer, Google Research In recent years, natural language processing models have dramatically improved their abilit...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Jiahui Yu, Senior Research Scientist, and Jing Yu Koh, Research Software Engineer, Google Research In recent years, natural language processing models have dramatically improved their ability to learn general-purpose representations, which has resulted in significant performance gains for a wide range of natural language generation and natural language understanding tasks. In large part, this has been accomplished through pre-training language models on extensive unlabeled text corpora...

item.description: Posted by Aurelien Boffy, Senior Staff Software Engineer, and Roberto Pieraccini, Engineering Director, Google Assistant When people converse with one another, context and references play a critical r...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Aurelien Boffy, Senior Staff Software Engineer, and Roberto Pieraccini, Engineering Director, Google Assistant When people converse with one another, context and references play a critical role in driving their conversation more efficiently. For instance, if one asks the question ‚ÄúWho wrote Romeo and Juliet?‚Äù and, after receiving an answer, asks ‚ÄúWhere was he born?‚Äù, it is clear that ‚Äòhe‚Äô is referring to William Shakespeare without the need to explicitly mention him.
